For what it is, it is very good. This is a reorder as the copy I had originally purchased got lost in a move among some other titles. Marie Forsa has been in a number of films, some more explicit than others, but in her case shot in a conservative way as she did not want be portrayed as a Porn Actress. Another good one with her is Flossie ( Mac Aumberg ). Justine and Juliet was good, but her role was somewhat subdued. This one is probably the best of the lot that I've seen with her, closely followed by Flossie and Bel Ami. Those three are probably her most explicit films.

Marie Forsa is an interesting case, a woman who was perfectly willing to have real sex on camera but only if it was shot in such a way that you couldn't prove it was real sex. Apparently it had to do with not being typed as a porn actress. Anyhow, to the best of my knowledge Butterflies is the only film she did where there is no question that she is really having sex. There are no hardcore penetration shots, but plenty of shots in which there's nowhere else the, ahem, anatomy we clearly see could possibly be going. Add to that the fact that this is a quality Joe Sarno product, and it's a film any Marie Forsa fan obviously has to have. Plus anybody else who like good erotica which isn't about closeups of genitals.

And oh yeah, this release includes the "Grindhouse" cut, which has the hardcore insert shots Sarno's cut leaves out. Some of these shots could have been performed by anybody, but in the first two scenes with Eric Edwards, some of the shots are definitely him, and everything matches the other footage extremely well. So I would not be surprised if it is also Marie Forsa, although there's no way to know for sure.

I found this movie years ago on VHS (hc edition)& fell in love with Marie.  I was disappointed in that copy as it cut off about 15 mins before the end.  I then found the DVD (sc edition) & discovered the rest.  DVD was a much better (technically) & complete than the VHS.  Then along came this edition with both versions of the movie.  She plays a beautiful, young & vivacious woman.  Naive about the world, but not her body.  Marie gives her all as a small town farm girl who goes off to the big city to be a model (leaving behind boyfriend Eric Edwards).  Instead, she finds a lingerie salesman who has her try on his wares in the forest.  Next up, she meets Harry (rich night club owner) & moves in with him in his groovy pad & girlfriend.  Marie quickly ousts the other.  Harry has sex with Marie & 3 or 4 other women throughout the movie until she grows tired of his exploits & storms out with just her suitcase & the clothes she came in with.
I am pleased to say that Joe Sarno became one of my favorite directors after this..
I am only lacking "Flossie" to finish up Marie's dvd collection.
Enjoy.

When videotape came along, it ruined everything and wrapped everything into dull, pointless sex.  I avoid all direct to video adult tapes like the plague.  Not worth a dime and boring, boring, boring.
I'm a fan of the old 70's genre. I like natural looks and pubic hair. It seems more real to life than gonzo. It's a keeper for the library.

Marie Forsa, face of an angel, body of a woman.  Butterflies is one of those motion pictures which has to be seen for all the right reasons.
This film which is co-starred with Harry Reems, this was a film that had the fight amount of erotic lust.  It tells the story of a young lady (Forsa) who wants to leave the village where she has lived and grown up in, and escape to the big city.  She does just that and has some interesting adventures along the way.
Marie Forsa is great.

WARNING !!!  The total runtime for these two discs are listed on Amazon at 300 minutes.
The total runtime I received (as printed on the back of the DVD case is 240 minutes (4-hours).

I am ONLY giving my rating of 4-stars because I suspect the movie is worthy of that. I'm not giving a bad review of the movie. I am giving a bad review of AMAZON for an incorrect listing.

BTW, heavy editing for American versions of many moves is very common, I don't know if this actually the situation here (whether or not the full runtime should be 240 minutes or 300 minutes. However, the frequent chopping of movies makes selection of DVDs very difficult.

Well, what can I post without getting yelled at? This movie is quite tame by today's standards, and is the best movie Joe Sarno ever made. This one ranks up there with the classic "Deep Throat," and has Harry Rheems is in it as well. But the scene stealer is the Swedish starlet Marie Forsa, making a name for herself in what is now-vintage adult movies. When she and Harry get intimate, there is some real sex taking place, believe me. Joe Sarno asked all his actors way back then to do anything they could to get across the fact they were enjoying their sexual adventures. It shows here, and this is a classic film not to be missed for those who want an adult film of high-quality now and then. The boyfriend at the beginning of the movie was Marie's real boyfriend at the time, too. Since Joe Sarno recently passed away and there is a documentary out at present of Joe and his wife, no one seems to know what happened to Ms Forsa. However, Harry Rheems eventually moved away from the adult film industry and worked with people who had various addictions. That is quite laudable, I think. Harry was interviewed before he died of pancreatic cancer, and spoke very proudly of his work with those involved in any type of addiction. Good for him. Enjoy the movie and notice the people in it are really acting. There are no fakes in this one.
Nice

I'm a middle aged single straight woman who enjoys watching certain types of porn while self pleasuring. This one did nothing for me. I don't care about the story or the artistry - purely the "turn on" factor, which - for this old gal - is MIA. There isn't a single scene I'd want to replay - which is my measure of good porn - the scene replay factor. I watched the grindhouse version. I can see why men would like this movie. I don't understand why reviewers with women's names rated it so highly. I feel misled by the reviewers on this one. For comparison, my likes are Pirates (the Joone film with Jessie Jane) and the Drive-In Collection Double Feature of Expectations and Confessions. If you like those, pass on this one.
If you're searching for great lesbian drama try Loving Annabelle, Blue is the Warmest Color, Perfect Ending or Spider Lilies. Don't waste your money on this piece of crap.
